newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela sees Andean Pact-Mercosur accord this yr.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela sees Andean Pact-Mercosur accord this yr.

text.p: Venezuela said Tuesday it was confident the Andean Community would reach a free trade pact with Mercosur by the end of this year, so creating the Americas' second largest trade grouping after NAFTA.

"Our objective is to agree on the signing and definition of a free trade zone between the Andean Community and Mercosur in 1997," Venezuelan Trade and Industry Minister Freddy Rojas Parra told Venezuela's foreign press association.

Parra said the two blocs -- the former groups Venezuela, Colombia, Ecuador Peru, and Bolivar, the latter Brazil, Argentina, Paraguay and Uruguay -- were set to negotiate on sensitive trade issues, such as agriculture, July 17 and 18.

"All the Mercosur countries are ready to proceed with the negotiations," he said. Andean businessmen and trade officials are first due to agree on a common position in Lima in talks set for July 8 and 10, he added.
